title: Using Conjunctions to Join Sentences
subject: Grammar
objective: Students will combine ideas using and, but, or, so, and because.

lessonFlow.content: Letâ€™s learn how to join two ideas into one strong sentence!

rules.example: She likes cats, and she likes dogs.
He is small, but he is fast.
She stayed home because she was sick.

activities.question: Which sentence uses 'but' correctly?
options: I am tired, but I will keep going.
I am tired but I eat dinner.
I am tired but I homework.
activities.explanation: This shows contrast with complete ideas.

questions.question: He ran fast ___ he was late.
questions.explanation: You need to show contrast by using conjunctions!

lessonFlow.instruction: Write a sentence using 'so' and another using 'but'.

lessonFlow.message: Fantastic! You can connect ideas like a pro!
